titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Civil War veterans portrait albums ARC.214
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Weatherly Stephan
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-08-25T14:58-0400

did.abstract: The Civil War veterans portrait albums date from circa 1863 to 1869 and contain 132 items. The albums consist of cartes-de-visite portraits and illustrations of Civil War veterans and notable individuals in early American history. Some portrait subjects are identified in the album; a partial name index is also included in the second volume.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Civil War veterans portrait albums date from circa 1863 to 1869 and contain 132 items. The albums consist of cartes-de-visite portraits and illustrations of Civil War veterans and notable individuals in early American history. Some portrait subjects are identified in the album; a partial name index is also included in the second volume.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: All items in this collection have entered the public domain. For information on securing rights to publish or reproduce, please see the Brooklyn Historical Society Reproduction Rights Policy.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids note
otherfindaid.p: Item-level description and digital versions of images from the collection are available for searching via the image database in the library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Fully processed to the item level. This collection combines two accessions: V1981.005 and V1981.006. Albums rehoused by John Zarrillo in August 2016.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: Additional Civil War-related portraits are available in the 67th New York Infantry Regiment portrait album, V1981.004.
